poem.title: Theism and Biscuits
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Before they took to brewing drouthy wine, the Israelites Got tannin chewing saddle girths, and spat. There's days I wish They'd traded jah for cha and druk pu-erh and read their tea leaves: A man will come with scandalous good news. Don't cross him; give him Tea and some of your granny's biscuits, hard as hockey pucks, to dook in it.
